medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent Clostridium difficile infection and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first case involved an 48-year-old man who had recurrent diarrhea for 8 months due to C. difficile infection, with multiple relapses after treatment with metronidazole and vancomycin. The second case involved a 48-year-old woman whose episodes resolved with vancomycin therapy but recurred after discontinuation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients have AIDS. The male patient was receiving highly active antiretroviral therapy with a last CD4 count of 1.25 × 10^9 cells/L and a viral load of less than 150 copies/mL. The female patient had type 2 diabetes mellitus and a last CD4 count of 0.15 × 10^9 cells/L and viral load of 320 copies/mL.
medical_history.family_history: The male patient's fecal microbiota was sourced from his mother, and the female patient's from her son.
